IX.iii.1.K.4.a
.
Deduction From Child’s Earned Income
Under
38 CFR 3.272(j)(1)
, a child’s
earned
income is countable only to the extent that it exceeds an amount equal to the lowest amount of gross income for which a single person must file a Federal income tax return.
This amount is adjusted each year by the Internal Revenue Service based on changes in the Consumer Price Index.  The current amount of the exclusion can be found in the
pension rate tables
.
This deduction applies regardless of whether the child is the person entitled or a dependent on a Veteran’s or surviving spouse’s award.
